params.name: auto_sum_strict
params.remarks: Enables (True) or disables (False) strict autosummation.

params.name: auto_summation
params.remarks: Enables (True) or disables (False) autosummation. Should always be enabled.

params.name: beam_center_x
params.remarks: Beam position on detector in pixels.

params.name: beam_center_y
params.remarks: Beam position on detector in pixels.

params.name: binning_mode
params.remarks: Defines how the physical pixels are being binned. This changes the behavior of the readout! Available binning modes can be requested by sending a GET request to the key binning_mode.

params.name: bit_depth_image
params.remarks: Bit depth of generated images.

params.name: bit_depth_readout
params.remarks: Bit depth of the internal readout.

params.name: chi_axis
params.remarks: Chi rotation axis given as a threedimensional unit vector in a right-handed system.

params.name: chi_increment
params.remarks: Chi increment per frame.

params.name: chi_start
params.remarks: Chi start angle (start angle of the first frame) for an exposure series.

params.name: compression
params.remarks: Defines the compression algorithm used. Allowed options are lz4 and bslz4. Information #6 To ensure highest stability at full frame rates, DECTRIS strongly advises using bslz4 compression. For enabling and disabling compression see section 5.3.1 FileWriter Configuration compression_enabled).

params.name: count_time
params.remarks: Exposure time per image.

params.name: counting_mode
params.remarks: Switch between normal (default) and retrigger counting mode. Other counting modes might be available for special applications.

params.name: countrate_correction_applied
params.remarks: Enables (True) or disables (False) countrate correction. Should always be enabled. See the User Manual for details.

params.name: countrate_correction_count_cutoff
params.remarks: Maximum number of possible counts per image after count rate correction. countrate_correction_table uint[] r Returns the countrate correction table.

params.name: data_collection_date
params.remarks: Date and time of data collection. This is the time when the ARM command was issued.

params.name: description
params.remarks: Detector model and type.

params.name: detector_distance
params.remarks: Sample to detector distance.

params.name: detector_number
params.remarks: Detector serial number.

params.name: detector_orientation
params.remarks: Together with detector_translation, this describes the coordinate transformation from detector coordinates to lab coordinates or the position of the detector in the lab.

params.name: detector_orientation_angle
params.remarks: Together with detector_orientation_axis, this describes the rotation part of the coordinate transformation from detector coordinates to lab coordinates or the position of the detector in the lab, the angle is given in degrees, a right-handed system is assumed.

params.name: detector_orientation_axis
params.remarks: Together with detector_orientation_angle, this describes the rotation part of the coordinate transformation from detector coordinates to lab coordinates or the position of the detector in the lab, a righthanded system is assumed.

params.name: detector_readout_time
params.remarks: Readout dead time between consecutive detector frames.

params.name: detector_translation
params.remarks: Together with the detector_orientation or detector_orientation_axis and detector_orientation_angle, this describes the coordinate transformation from detector coordinates to lab coordinates or the position of the detector in the lab.

params.name: eiger_fw_version
params.remarks: Returns the currently running app-detector version.

params.name: element
params.remarks: Sets parameter photon_energy to the Kalpha fluorescence radiation energy of an element.

params.name: extg_mode
params.remarks: Can only be used when in extg trigger mode. Values can either be single to make full use of both internal counters or double to acquire 32 bit images for high dynamic range measurements. See the User Manual for details.

params.name: flatfield
params.remarks: Flatfield correction factors used for flatfield correction. Pixel data are multiplied with these factors for calculating flatfield corrected data. This key is mapped to threshold/1/flatfield.

params.name: flatfield_correction_applied
params.remarks: Enables (True) or disables (False) flatfield correction. Should always be enabled.

params.name: flux_type
params.remarks: Type of flux, the flux value is set via flux_value. The following types can be set: • ”flux”: Flux density incident on beam plane area in photons per second per unit area.

params.name: flux_value
params.remarks: Flux value of type flux_type. In case of a beam that varies in flux shot-to-shot, this is an array of values, one for each recorded shot. This information is required by the NXmx application definition 3 Information #9 Part of FileWriter metadata only if format is set to ”hdf5 nexus v2024.2 nxmx” 2 3

params.name: frame_count_time
params.remarks: Time interval between start of image acquisitions for sub-images when auto_summation is enabled

params.name: frame_time
params.remarks: Time interval between start of image acquisitions. This defines the speed of data collection and is the inverse of the frame rate, the frequency of image acquisition. see https://manual.nexusformat.org/classes/applications/NXmx.html see https://manual.nexusformat.org/classes/applications/NXmx.html

params.name: incident_energy
params.remarks: Energy of incident particles (e.g. X-rays) in eV.

params.name: instrument_name
params.remarks: Name of the instrument or beamline. Consistency with the controlled vocabulary beamline naming 4 is highly recommended. This information is required by the NXmx application definition 5 , an empty string will be interpreted as not set. Information #10 Part of FileWriter metadata only if format is set to ”hdf5 nexus v2024.2 nxmx” 4 5

params.name: kappa_axis
params.remarks: Kappa rotation axis given as a threedimensional unit vector in a right-handed system.

params.name: kappa_increment
params.remarks: Kappa increment per frame.

params.name: kappa_start
params.remarks: Kappa start angle (start angle of the first frame).

params.name: mask_to_zero
params.remarks: If set to True, pixels marked in the pixel_mask will be set to zero instead of the maximum representable value.This may be preferred by some analysis software. Default: False.

params.name: nexpi
params.remarks: Number of exposures per image. Only applicable during extg trigger mode. See the User Manual for details.

params.name: nimages
params.remarks: Number of images. See the User Manual for details.

params.name: ntrigger
params.remarks: Number of triggers. See the User Manual for details.

params.name: number_of_excluded_pixels
params.remarks: Total number of defective, disabled or inactive pixels.

params.name: omega_axis
params.remarks: Omega rotation axis given as a threedimensional unit vector in a right-handed system.

params.name: omega_increment
params.remarks: Omega increment per frame.

params.name: omega_start
params.remarks: Omega start angle (start angle of the first frame). see https://mmcif.wwpdb.org/dictionaries/mmcif_pdbx_v50.dic/Items/_diffrn_source.pdbx_synchrotron_beamline.html and https:// mmcif.wwpdb.org/dictionaries/mmcif_pdbx_v50.dic/Items/_diffrn_source.type.html see https://manual.nexusformat.org/classes/applications/NXmx.html

params.name: phi_axis
params.remarks: Phi rotation axis given as a threedimensional unit vector in a right-handed system.

params.name: phi_increment
params.remarks: Phi increment per frame.

params.name: phi_start
params.remarks: Phi start angle (start angle of the first frame).

params.name: photon_energy
params.remarks: Energy of incident X-rays.

params.name: pixel_format
params.remarks: Defines which data format is returned from the module. The maximum performance of the detector is depending on the selected pixel format 6 . Available pixel formats can be requested by sending a GET request to the key pixel_format. Caution #4 The pixel format can only be changed if the configured frame rate is within the allowed bounds of the new format.

params.name: pixel_mask
params.remarks: This key is mapped to threshold/1/pixel_mask. A bit mask that labels and classifies pixels which are either defective, inactive or exhibit non-standard behavior Bit 0: gap (pixel with no sensor) Bit 1: dead Bit 2: under responding Bit 3: over responding Bit 4: noisy Bit 5-31: -undefinedInformation #11 Please note that the actual integer value of a pixel in t...

params.name: pixel_mask_applied
params.remarks: Enables (True) or disables (False) applying the pixel mask on the acquired data. If True (default), pixels that have a corresponding bit set in the pixel_mask are flagged with (2∧ bit_depth_image)-1. If disabled, the pixel mask needs to be applied at the point of data processing.

params.name: roi_bit_depth
params.remarks: Bit depth of generated images when using lines ROI 7 . 8 Bit required for max frame rate acquisitions!

params.name: roi_mode
params.remarks: Selects the region of interest (ROI). ROI modes enable higher frame rates due to reduced readout area 8 . Available ROI modes can be requested by sending a GET request to the key roi_mode.

params.name: roi_y_size
params.remarks: Defines total height (y size) of output image when using lines ROI 9

params.name: sample_name
params.remarks: Name of the sample. This information is required by the NXmx application definition 10 , an empty string will be interpreted as not set. Information #12 Part of FileWriter metadata only if format is set to ”hdf5 nexus v2024.2 nxmx”

params.name: sensor_material
params.remarks: Material used for direct detection of X-rays in the sensor.

params.name: sensor_thickness
params.remarks: Thickness of the sensor material.

params.name: software_version
params.remarks: Software version used for data acquisition and correction. 7 Only available for certain detectors. Please refer to the User Manual and Technical specifications for further details.

params.name: source_name
params.remarks: Name of the neutron or x-ray storage ring/facility. Consistency with the naming in synchrotoron controlled vocabulary 11 is highly recommended. This information is required by the NXmx application definition 12 , an empty string will be interpreted as not set. Information #13 Part of FileWriter metadata only if format is set to ”hdf5 nexus v2024.2 nxmx”

params.name: test_image_mode
params.remarks: A ”non-empty” string value enables a test image readout and selects the type of the test image. The following test image modes are supported by all systems: ”value”: A simulated readout which takes the value from test_image_value and includes it in every pixel of the image data.

params.name: test_image_value
params.remarks: Value to configure some test image modes.

params.name: threshold/difference/lower_threshold
params.remarks: Lower threshold used for calculating difference images. Difference images are calculated by subtracting the counts of the upper threshold image from the counts of the lower threshold image. Only available for detectors with more than one threshold.

params.name: threshold/difference/mode
params.remarks: Calculation of difference images, which can be ’enabled’ or ’disabled’. When disabled, no difference images will be written to file or delivered from any other data interface. Only available for detectors with more than one threshold. Information #19 If threshold/difference/mode is to be used, all threshold/n/mode have to be enabled beforehand.

params.name: threshold/difference/upper_threshold
params.remarks: Upper threshold used for calculating difference images. Difference images are calculated by subtracting the counts of the upper threshold image from the counts of the lower threshold image. Only available for detectors with more than one threshold.

params.name: threshold/n/energy
params.remarks: Threshold energy for X-ray counting for threshold n. Energies should be increasing with the treshold number n. Example: threshold/1 < threshold/2 < threshold/n-1 < threshold/n 13

params.name: threshold/n/flatfield
params.remarks: Flatfield correction factors used for flatfield correction. Pixel data are multiplied with these factors for calculating flatfield corrected data. Information #16 Customer specific flatfields can be uploaded after setting the threshold_energy and photon_energy.

params.name: threshold/n/mode
params.remarks: Image data acquisition for threshold n, which can be ’enabled’ or ’disabled’. When disabled, no image data from this threshold will be written to file or delivered from any other data interface. Information #17 If threshold/difference/mode is to be used, all threshold/n/mode have to be enabled beforehand.a a

params.name: threshold/n/number_of_excluded_pixels
params.remarks: Only available for certain detectors. Please refer to the User Manual and Technical specifications for further details. Total number of defective, disabled or inactive pixels for threshold n.

params.name: threshold/n/pixel_mask
params.remarks: A bit mask that labels and classifies pixels which are either defective, inactive or exhibit non-standard behavior Bit 0: gap (pixel with no sensor) Bit 1: dead Bit 2: under responding Bit 3: over responding Bit 4: noisy Bit 5-31: -undefinedInformation #18 Please note that the actual integer value of a pixel in the mask depends on which bits are set, e.g. a...

params.name: threshold_energy
params.remarks: Threshold energy for X-ray counting. Photons with an energy below the threshold are not detected. See the User Manual for details. Information #14 For detectors with more than one threshold, this resource is mapped to the resource threshold/1/energy.

params.name: transformation_order
params.remarks: Order of execution for goniometer rotation axes. Allowed values are chi, kappa, omega and phi. Let transformation_order = [kappa, chi] and Rkappa , Rchi the corresponding transformation matrices, then the combined transformation would be Rchi Rkappa .

params.name: trigger_mode
params.remarks: Mode of triggering image acquisition. See the User Manual for details.

params.name: trigger_start_delay
params.remarks: Delayed time from when the trigger comes until the configured series starts. Trigger Start Delay can be used in ints and exts mode.

params.name: two_theta_axis
params.remarks: Two theta rotation axis given as a threedimensional unit vector in a right-handed system.

params.name: two_theta_increment
params.remarks: Two theta increment per frame.

params.name: two_theta_start
params.remarks: Two theta start angle (start angle of the first frame).

params.name: virtual_pixel_correction_applied
params.remarks: Enables (True) or disables (False) applying the virtual_pixel_correction on the acquired data.

params.name: wavelength
params.remarks: Wavelength of incident X-rays. See the User Manual for details.

params.name: x_pixel_size
params.remarks: Size of a single pixel along x-axis of the detector.

params.name: x_pixels_in_detector
params.remarks: Number of pixels along x-axis of the detector.

params.name: y_pixel_size
params.remarks: Size of a single pixel along y-axis of the detector.

params.name: y_pixels_in_detector
params.remarks: Number of pixels along y-axis of the detector. JSON Serialization Meta information in the body of the request and in the reply from the HTTP server are serialized in the JSON format and described in the table below.

params.name: board_000/th0_humidity
params.remarks: Caution This parameter is please use humidity. #6 deprecated, Relative humidity reported by humidity sensor.

params.name: board_000/th0_temp
params.remarks: Caution #7 This parameter is deprecated, please use temperature. Temperature reported by temperature sensor.

params.name: error
params.remarks: Always returns empty list. Only available for backwards compability

params.name: high_voltage/state
params.remarks: Returns high voltage state of target (NA, OFF, RAMPING, READY). Information #20 For optimal data quality acquisitions should only be started when state is READY.

params.name: humidity
params.remarks: Humidity inside the detector module compartment.

params.name: state
params.remarks: Possible states: na (not available), ready, initialize, configure, acquire, idle, test, error. Information #21 State is ”na”, when the DCU is booted or the acquisition service was restarted.

params.name: temperature
params.remarks: Detector temperature.

params.name: time
params.remarks: Returns current system time. Formatted according to ISO 8601 JSON Serialization Get requests have no body. The returned JSON of a get request string contains a subset of the fields below. Only fields which are applicable for a given resource are present in the returned JSON.

params.name: buffer_size
params.remarks: Specifies the maximum number of exposures that may be buffered by the Monitor. The effective size of the buffer may be smaller depending on the active configuration and amount of allocated memory (see buffer_free). Default: 100.

params.name: discard_new
params.remarks: When true, new exposures are dropped when the Monitor buffer is full. Shrinking the size of the buffer will evict (drop) newer exposures first. When false, older exposures will be evicted (dropped) when the buffer is full or shrunk. Default: true.

params.name: mode
params.remarks: Operational mode of the Monitor. When set to enabled, the Monitor processes incoming exposures. When set to disabled, incoming exposures are ignored and do not affect the Monitor.

params.name: buffer_free
params.remarks: The remaining buffer space in bytes. Note: The total available space in bytes is based on the amount of allocated memory and is unaffected by buffer_size.

params.name: dropped
params.remarks: Number of images which were dropped as not requested.

params.name: error
params.remarks: Unused.

params.name: state
params.remarks: The value overflow if images were dropped due to a full buffer, otherwise the value normal. 5.2.4. Monitor Command Parameters To clear the buffer of images, the following command can be executed at the address http://<address_of_dcu>/monitor/api/1.8.0/command/clear []$_ URLs <uri> = http://<ADDRESS_of_DCU>/monitor/api/<VERSION>/command/<PARAMETER>

params.name: monitor
params.remarks: Gets the last (newest) exposure. Default waits for 500 ms for image. Timeout adjustable by adding query string ?timeout=<ms> to URI. Returns 408 if no image is available.

params.name: next
params.remarks: Gets the oldest image (next in order) and removes it from the buffer. Default waits for 500 ms for image. Timeout via ?timeout=<ms> adjustable. Returns 408 if no image available.

params.name: compression_enabled
params.remarks: Enables (True) or disables (False) compression of detector data written to HDF5 files. Compression is required for full detector performance, disabling compression may lead to data loss at high frame rates. For compression modes see section 5.1.1 Detector Configuration Parameters (compression).

params.name: format
params.remarks: Select the format of the files written by FileWriter. • ”hdf5 nexus legacy nxmx”: HDF5 files where the metadata of the master file is following the NXmx application definition of the NeXus 3.

params.name: image_nr_start
params.remarks: Sets the image_nr_low metadata parameter in the first HDF5 data file <name_pattern>_data_000001.h5. This parameter is useful when a data set is collected in more than one HDF5 file structures. If you collect image number m to n in the first file structure, you can set image_nr_start to n+1 in the subsequent file structure.

params.name: mode
params.remarks: Operation mode of the FileWriter, which can be enabled or disabled. During an active acquisition the interface remains enabled and will be disabled after receiving the end of series message.

params.name: name_pattern
params.remarks: The basename of the file. The pattern $id will include the sequence number in the file name. series_$id is the default name pattern, resulting in the following names of the HDF5 file structure created by the FileWriter: series_<sequence_nr>_master.

params.name: nimages_per_file
params.remarks: Maximum number of images stored in each <name_pattern>_data_<file_nr>.h5 file in the HDF5 file structure created by the FileWriter. Data files are only created when <nimages_per_file> is reached or when detector command disarm is sent.

params.name: buffer_free
params.remarks: The remaining buffer space in Bytes.

params.name: error
params.remarks: Returns list of status parameters causing error condition.

params.name: files
params.remarks: Returns list of available files on the DCU.

params.name: state
params.remarks: Possible states: disabled, ready, acquire, error. 5.3.4. FileWriter Command Parameters Command parameters are write only. The base path to the resource is: []$_ URL <uri> = http://<ADDRESS_OF_DCU>/filewriter/api/<VERSION>/command/<PARAMETER>

params.name: format
params.remarks: Select the format of the event messages. • legacy: Use legacy multi-part JSON messages. • cbor: Use CBOR messages. See also https://github.com/dectris/ documentation/tree/main/stream_v2

params.name: header_appendix
params.remarks: User data to be included in start event messages. If legacy stream format is selected, data will be visible as string in header_appendix JSON message.

params.name: header_detail
params.remarks: Select which fields are sent in the start messages: • all: All fields • basic: Exclude flatfield and pixel mask • none: No meta data Caution #12 If header_detail ”none” is selected, no experimental meta-data is transferred, complicating processing and archiving of the data. Therefore, usage of header_detail ”none” is discouraged.

params.name: image_appendix
params.remarks: User data to be included in start event messages. If legacy stream format is selected, data will be visible as string in image_appendix JSON message.

params.name: mode
params.remarks: State of the stream interface, either enabled or disabled.

params.name: dropped
params.remarks: Number of images that got dropped as not requested. After ”arm” this number is reset to zero.

params.name: state
params.remarks: disabled, ready, acquire or error. After the detector has been armed the state becomes acquire, after disarm, abort or cancel the state becomes ready. There are currently no error conditions. 5.4.5. Stream Command Parameters Command parameters are write only. The base path to the resource is:

params.name: datetime/date
params.remarks: Returns or sets the current date.

params.name: datetime/ntp
params.remarks: Enables (on) or disables (off) Network Time Protocol (NTP).

params.name: datetime/ntp_server
params.remarks: Returns or sets the comma seperate list of Network Time Protocol (NTP) servers.

params.name: datetime/time
params.remarks: Gets or sets the current time (HH:MM:SS).

params.name: datetime/timezone
params.remarks: Gets or sets the current timezone. Also returns list of available timezones on a GET request.

params.name: network/n/addr
params.remarks: Returns or sets the network address (IP) of the detector control unit network interface ”n”. Information #26 Please note that the fall-back interface configurations are read-only.

params.name: network/n/dhcp
params.remarks: Enables (on) or disables (off) DHCP for detector control unit network interface ”n”.

params.name: network/n/dns1
params.remarks: Returns or sets the primary domain name server (DNS) for detector control unit network interface ”n”.

params.name: network/n/dns2
params.remarks: Returns or sets the secondary domain name server (DNS) for detector control unit network interface ”n”.

params.name: network/n/mtu
params.remarks: Returns or sets the maximum transmission unit (MTU) for detector control unit network interface ”n”.

params.name: network/n/netmask
params.remarks: Return or sets the netmask for detector control unit network interface ”n”.

params.name: network/n/static_routes
params.remarks: Return or sets the static routes for detector control unit network interface ”n”. Information #28 Example: ”value”:[”gateway”:”192.168.50.2”, ”destination”:”10.20.1.1/32”, ”gateway”:”192.168.50.3”, ”destination”:”10.30.0.0/16”]

params.name: system_info/service_tag
params.remarks: Returns the DELL service tag of the detector control unit. 5.5.2. System Command Parameters Command parameters are write only. The base path to the resource is: []$_ URL <uri> = http://<ADDRESS_OF_DCU>/system/api/<VERSION>/command/<PARAMETER>
